intro: Clathrotropis brunnea, commonly known as the brown clathrotropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain small, round seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
